story.text: AMSTERDAM Jan 3 Dutch supermarkets realised a 3.9 percent sales growth in 2006 to 27.2 billion euros ($36.11 billion) compared to 2005, market researcher GfK said on Wednesday. Sales during the holiday season were at a new record of 737.6 million euros, the market researcher said in statement. GfK said in November it expected 2007 sales to rise 2.7 percent to 27.8 billion euros.
story.title: dutch supermarket sales up 4 pct in 2006
